Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goose (small part of body and wing; advanced left leg in outline) to right; swastika as filling ornament; below, zigzag pattern; on cul, triple maeander band; band below.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the lack of interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 73, p. 238, no. 182)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0123) (phase 2)
